sentence.Network_cn: 5月，教皇约翰·保罗将为吉安娜·贝雷塔行宣福礼。

list.abs: we should spare no effort to beatify our environment .我们应该不遗余力的美化我们的环境。
... . . .。死后他因他献身宗教，被册封为圣人，但这一进程要求后被罗马教皇格雷戈里十一世宣布无效。在1904年，他被宣福(beatified)。3子女妻子德勒的让娜(Joanna of Dreux)，五个孩子.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the sense 'make blessed or supremely happy'): from Old French beatifier or ecclesiastical Latin beatificare, from Latin beatus 'blessed'

entry.def: When the Catholic church beatifies someone who is dead, it declares officially that they were a holy person, usually as the first step towards making them a saint.

example.ex: In May, Pope John Paul is to beatify Gianna Beretta.
example.tran: 5月，教皇约翰·保罗将为吉安娜·贝雷塔行宣福礼。

means.word_mean: 1. fill with sublime emotion; tickle pink (exhilarate is obsolete in this usage);

sentences.sentence: "The children were thrilled at the prospect of going to the movies"
"He was inebriated by his phenomenal success"

means.word_mean: 3. declare (a dead person) to be blessed; the first step of achieving sainthood;

sentences.sentence: "On Sunday, the martyr will be beatified by the Vatican"
